Package stork.feather

Classes and interfaces for implementing data transfer applications using the Feather framework.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Transfer<S extends Resource,D extends Resource>
    A handle on the state of a data transfer.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Bell<T>
    A promise primitive used for stringing together the results of asynchronous operations and executing asynchronous handlers.
    Bell.All<V>
    A bell which rings when all of the given bells rings successfully, or fails if any fail.
    Bell.And
    A bell which rings with true if all of the wrapped bells ring with true, or false if any of them ring with false.
    Bell.Any<V>
    A bell which rings when the first of the given bells rings successfully, or else fails if they all fail.
    Bell.MultiBell<I>
    Base class for bells whose resolution value depends on the resolution values of a collection of other bells.
    Bell.Or
    A bell which rings with true if any of the wrapped bells ring with true, or false if all of them ring with false.
    Credential<O>
    An abstract authentication factor for authenticating with a remote system.
    Intern<O>
    A object internalization utility based on soft references.
    Path
    A representation of an absolute Path adhering to RFC 3986's definition of URI path components extended to support glob pattern matching.
    PipeElement<R extends Resource>
    An abstract base class for anything which can serve as an element in a proxy transfer pipeline.
    ProxyTransfer<S extends Resource,D extends Resource>
    A mediator for a locally proxied data transfer.
    Relative<T>
    An object wrapper with contextual information regarding the object's origin in some hierarchical transaction.
    Resource<S extends Session<S,R>,R extends Resource<S,R>>
    A virtual representation of a physical resource.
    Session<S extends Session<S,R>,R extends Resource<S,R>>
    A Session is a stateful context for operating on Resources.
    Sink<R extends Resource>
    A Sink is a destination for Slices emitted by Taps.
    Slice
    A Slice represents a concrete, contiguous segment of a data emitted by a Tap, and is the fundamental unit of data transfer in a proxy pipeline.
    Stat
    Metadata about a resource, including subresources if the resource is a directory.
    Tap<R extends Resource>
    A Tap emits Slices to an attached Sink.
    URI
    A representation of a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).
    URI.Builder
    This is the default mutable URI implementation.

Package stork.feather Description

Classes and interfaces for implementing data transfer applications using the Feather framework. Feather is a framework for enacting asynchronous transactions on heterogeneous endpoint resources. In other words, data transfer applications built using Feather provide a common interface through which data resources on remote storage systems may be transferred and have their metadata manipulated. The protocol-agnostic abstraction layer provided by a Feather implementation yields a mechanism for streaming data to any other Feather implementation regardless of the underlying transfer protocol, allowing for proxied data transfer between heterogeneous data storage endpoints.
